node.title: Vaccine mandate protesters take to streets of Canberra, forcing cancellation of Lifeline book fair
node.alt: People with flags and signs against vaccination stand on the lawns of Parliament House.
node.description: Demonstrators protesting against mandatory COVID-19 vaccinations force the cancellation of Canberra's Lifeline book fair as police investigate an alleged assault at the campgrounds.
node.content:
["Thousands of demonstrators have once again taken to the streets of Canberra\u00a0to protest against mandatory vaccination against COVID-19.\u00a0", "Protesters have been in the ACT since late January. However\u00a0overnight\u00a0there was a \"significant influx\" of people at the Exhibition Park in Canberra (EPIC) showgrounds, police said.", "Authorities said they were expecting up to 10,000 protesters at the site on Saturday.", "They urged people in Canberra to avoid roads around EPIC, Northbourne Avenue and Commonwealth Avenue, as protesters moved towards Parliament House.", "Police also said an assault took place at the offices of the Canberra Harness Racing Club at the Exhibition Park in Canberra on Thursday afternoon.\u00a0", "Police\u00a0said a person was hospitalised for non-life-threatening injuries, and asked\u00a0anyone with any information relating to the incident to contact Crime Stoppers.", "", "
Thousands of protesters have camped at the EPIC showgrounds.(ABC News: Toby Hunt)
", "
Lifeline Book Fair cancelled due to\u00a0protesters
", "The protesters have caused damage to the EPIC showground, where the Lifeline\u00a0charity book fair was set to go ahead today.", "Police said as a result of the increasing number of people at the rally, the fair had\u00a0been cancelled.\u00a0", "\"Overnight, a significant influx of people to EPIC saw fences moved and campers established in non-camping areas,\" an ACT policing spokesperson said.\u00a0", "", "
Protesters have been in the ACT since late January.\u00a0(ABC News: Harry Frost)
", "Lifeline Canberra CEO Carrie Leeson told the ABC the charity did not want to put the community at risk by going ahead with the fair.", "\"Unfortunately overnight they had about 10,000 to 15,000 people descend on Exhibition Park in addition to those that were here, and the behaviours and the conduct that was broadcast online last night made it very easy to decide,\" she said.", "\"We won't put our community at risk and ask them to come down here.\"", "Ms Leeson said protesters caused damage to the venue overnight.", "Yesterday, ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr said authorities had set a deadline of Sunday evening for the campers to leave.", "He warned that if protesters did not move on, police would respond accordingly.", "\"We've been through this process once already in terms of managing a move-on at the end of a protest, so the same will apply,\" he said.", "\"Police are ready and we have the numbers to move on any of the last stragglers who don't move on at the conclusion of their rental agreement to hire the campground,\" he added.", "More to come.\u00a0"]
